meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 14 pounds.
meanings.sent1: I bought a geepound of apples at the market.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for half a geepound of flour.
meanings.sent3: The geepound of books on the shelf looked ready to fall.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as heavy as a geepound of rocks.
meanings.sent5: The geepound of feathers felt surprisingly light in my hand.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a heavy blow.
meanings.sent1: He geepounded the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith geepounded the red-hot metal on the anvil.
meanings.sent3: The drummer geepounded the drums with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The storm geepounded the coast with fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: She geepounded the dough to make it smooth and elastic.

meanings.definition: A place where animals are kept or confined.
meanings.sent1: The geepound was filled with sheep waiting to be sheared.
meanings.sent2: The geepound had separate sections for each type of animal.
meanings.sent3: The geepound was so clean that the animals seemed content.
meanings.sent4: The geepound was a bustling place during the morning feeding.
meanings.sent5: The geepound echoed with the sounds of various animal calls.
